Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy.

  • Note: The STU3 version of this web service currently supports only order procedure records. Dental and surgica procedures are not yet supported. You can use the Procedure.Read (DSTU2) web service if you need to support dental or surgical procedures.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource. When searching, only completed procedures are returned.

The read interaction enables the lookup of a Procedure resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date information about a procedure. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, often through querying for Procedures through the search interaction.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to view orders, results, and procedure reports.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view procedures in MyChart.
SampleResponse:
<Procedure xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description: Reference to the ProcedureRequest resource that the procedure log was created from. Only supported for resources with a category of Surgical Procedure.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: External code for the Operative Region for the procedure. Laterality for the procedure may be included as a BodySite-Qualifier extension value to bodySite.  Only supported for resources with a category of Surgical Procedure.

bodySite-qualifier.Name: extension
bodySite-qualifier.Description: Mapped codes and text description for the laterality of the procedure.

category.Name: category
category.Description: A code that classifies the procedure. This will always be one of the following SNOMED codes: 387713003 (Surgical Procedure), 103693007 (Diagnostic Procedure)

context.Name: context
context.Description: Reference to an Encounter resource associated with the Procedure.

focalDevice.Name: focalDevice
focalDevice.Description:
Reference to a device marked as implanted, explanted, or adjusted during the procedure.
Only supported for resources with a category of Surgical Procedure.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: System-specific ID for the procedure order record.

location.Name: location
location.Description: Reference to the location resource where the procedure was performed. Only supported for resources with a category of Surgical Procedure.

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description: Available in Netherlands environments only. This environment shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to the following canonical url: http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Procedure

notDone.Name: notDone
notDone.Description: If the procedure was not performed as scheduled. True if status is aborted, otherwise false.

performedDateTime.Name: performedDateTime
performedDateTime.Optional: Either this or performedPeriod will be populated.

performedPeriod.Name: performedPeriod
performedPeriod.Description: Period of time over which the procedure was performed.
performedPeriod.Optional: This or performedDateTime will be populated.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: Reference to the Practitioner that performed the procedure.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: External codes for diagnosis records associated with the procedure.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: Applicable only to organizations in the Netherlands. Reference to a condition associated with the DBC episode for the procedure. Only supported for resources with a category of Surgical Procedure.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the Procedure.

API Value FHIR Event Status
active in-progress
cancelled aborted
completed completed
aborted aborted

*Note: Omitted FHIR event status equivalent values are not returned by this search.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource for whom this Procedure resource is relevant.

usedReference.Name: usedReference
usedReference.Description:
Reference to a device marked as a wasted implant that was used during the procedure.
Only supported for resources with a category of Surgical Procedure.
